body.name: WEEMSBOX Wireless Ergonomic Mouse, 2.4GHz, 15m Transmission Range, 5 DPI Levels, 120mm Long, Black
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Saturday, February 17 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 13. Order within 3 hrs 39 mins
features: More Comfortable Ergonomic Design - Designed for right-handed, the mini contoured shape fits your hands perfectly. The rubberized scroll wheel ensures that your hand does not slip when using the wireless mouse. The side buttons can help you move forward and backward when browsing the web.

Excellent Value - Tested over 5 million keystrokes, the computer mouse is extremely durable for long life. 2.4G wireless technology Offers secure connection for transmission range of 15m/49ft . ** Please Note: The USB receiver is stored at the bottom of the mouse.**

Energy-Saving - The ergonomic cordless mouse will turn off automatically after 8 minutes of inactivity. Up to 15 months of battery life virtually with a single AA battery (NOT INCLUDED) eliminates the need to change batteries. Battery life may vary depending on the conditions of use and the computer. The laptop mouse will turn off when the PC is off or the receiver is disconnected.

Work Efficiently - 5 DPI level choice, 2400/2000/1600/1200/800, easy to change the cursor sensitivity of wireless mouse freely ,can perfectly meet the needs both in home and office,greatly improving efficiency by up to 120%. Plug and play, no drivers needed.

TruWave Precision - For precise cursor control, we uses TruWave Technology which is smart on many types of surfaces.Perfect compatible with Win 7/ 8/ 10/ XP, Vista 7/ 8 and Linux/laptop,PC,Chromebook,desktop,computer.For Mac OS, the side buttons do not work. Note: Side buttons are invalid in Mac OS.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Hope all of you Enjoy Life,feel Warm in the Cold Winter! Are you angry with the lag mouse?Do you want to work higher efficiency?Do you want to make relax working time? Specification Color: Black Mouse size: 4.09 x 2.76 x 1.69inch/103.5X 70.5 X 38.6mm Number of the Key: 6 Buttons DPI: 800-1200-1600-2000-2400 Power Source: 1*AA Battery(Not included)

ATTENTION The Back and Forward Buttons are not available for Mac OS,and the other function can be used normally.The USB reciever is stored on the back of the mouse.This mouse is powered by the 1*AA battery which is not included.Please check the size before purchase if you mind it. FAQ Q : Where is the usb receiver? A : The usb receiver is stored on the back of the wireless mouse Q : What is the size? A : 4.09 x 2.76 x 1.69inch/103.5X 70.5 X 38.6mm Q : Is it compatible with the Chromebook? A : Yes,of course.It can be compatile with the chromesbook,Windows 7/8/10/XP/Vista,Linux,Mac,IOS. Q : How long is the battery life? A : The laptop mouse is up to 15 months battery life.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is the only mouse I've bought for over 10 years
reviews.reviewText: I have purchased about 5-6 of these over the years. One got wonky with the wheel button which I attributed to gunk but was unable to clear fully. My wife has one on the dining room table with her laptop, I have one on my desk with my laptops. I have one in my travel bag, and I have a couple at other haunts that I'm at regularly waiting for me to visit.It's the most comfortable mouse I've ever used - since 1990-someting or other. The wheel works great, I can change the DPI to change how fast the cursor moves, I can use the side buttons to back/forward my web surfing... The battery life is excellent... For the price, I feel like I get every penny of use out of these!Buy it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My favorite mouse
reviews.reviewText: I have three of these mice. At work, and with my telework set up, and my MAC at home. The shape is ergonomic and very comfortable. It’s not too big or too small….. just right. XOXO Goldilocks 😁

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars I like them. They last a year or two.
reviews.reviewText: They last for a year or two. Good enough for me.I have purchased this mouse before under a different name (Tsing or something like that). But the logo and design are all exactly the same, even the manual is exactly the same.I have purchased 5 of these mice in the past 5 years. (for use on two separate computers). This new one and one of the older ones still work. I find that they last for about 1-2 years with consistent or heavy use. I used the one I just replaced for gaming and it still lasted 2 years.They all fail the same way. The wheel starts scrolling the page up when it should be going down or visversa. Minor at first then big jumps. Then later the page will start randomly scrolling by itself. It's the wheel of the mouse. The first one that failed I took it apart and fixed it, it worked for another month then it broke again so I just got a new one. They have all failed the same way. So now I know when it starts skipping up instead of down that my mouse is at the beginnings of failing.The other buttons all still work properly but the wheel does not. I use the wheel pretty regularly so for me, when the wheel fails it's time for a new mouse.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I HAVE BOUGHT 3 OF THESE AND LOVE THIS WIRELESS MOUSE!
reviews.reviewText: I bought my son this mouse for homeschool use with his computer - it works well and the battery life is amazing.My husband needed a new mouse so I got him the same mouse, he loves it. Its affordable and the battery life is amazing still. No issues.I have a feeling my family is just going to own only this mouse, my daughter needed a mouse to replace her old wire one, its easy to use and her small hand fits it well. Again the battery life is amazing. We love this brand. I am looking into buying 2 more for my two computers since it works so well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best Low Price Mouse
reviews.reviewText: I had this mouse for about two years before I bought a new one. It’s comfortable, easy to use, and has a long last battery. I also used it for gaming. I do recommend buying a mouse pad with it. Overall it's an incredible mouse even though it's low price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good quality mouse for little money
reviews.reviewText: I had two of these before and they were doing the job for many years until I put a R**vac battery in one of them. The mouse still worked although the battery had already leaked out and eaten up the circuit board.With the replacement mouse I had a little issue for a moment as it connected to a computer that had my old mouse plugged in. It did not want to connect to the receiver that came with it. At first I thought I had a bad receiver but that was not the case. All I had to do is unplug all the receivers from the other computers so the new receiver could connect to the new mouse. After reinstalling all the other receivers every mouse controlled the PC it was intended to. All is good again in my little PC universe...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Scroll wheel issues
reviews.reviewText: I have an abusive relationship with this mouse.I bought my first one several years ago and it was love at first sight. I'd never had a wireless mouse before, and it felt freeing not being attached to my computer. It held my hand through video games, term papers, mundane web browsing...and then one day the scroll wheel started acting up. I'd be scrolling down a webpage and it'd fight me the whole way down, taking one step back for every two steps forward. We went on like this for a few months before I'd had enough. It had gotten so bad that the scroll wheel's only function was to make the screen twitch up and down. I figured I'd gotten a good year or so out of it and for $11 that's not bad, so I left.I started to look back on all our good times together, how well it fit in my hand, how responsive it was, the variable DPI, the thumb buttons. I thought about it a lot and I decided we'd try again, so I ordered another one. It felt like a fresh start. We were getting along great and it was looking like we'd be together forever. After a few months though the middle mouse button started getting lazy. I'd have to press down hard to get it to respond. Just like before, the problem got worse over a few months and it got unbearable. I tried everything I could think of - I took it apart and applied some canned air to the button, I uninstalled and reinstalled the drivers, but it didn't want to change. We dealt with each other's hostility for a time and I finally decided it was time to part ways.But once again I chose to ignore the bad times and focus on the good. Nostalgia got the better of me and soon enough I broke down and ordered my third mouse. I thought "this time will be different. I'll treat it extra nice and it'll do what it promised it would". But it wasn't different. This time it only took 2 months before the scroll wheel problems started. It was the same situation as before - two steps forward, one step back.They say the definition of insanity is doing the same thing over and over and expecting different results... but for $11 can you really blame me?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best wireless mouse I have purchased so far
reviews.reviewText: When it comes to using a mouse on my lap top computer or my desktop computer you just can't beat this product for ease of maintenance and operation. The 'hand feel' on it is also very good. I highly recommend. I own two of them now and they just keep running and running. Battery seems to last forever. (it's a AA, one battery)
